details: The script runs xcpengine in a Singularity container.
It uses SLURM to allocate resources on a cluster.
It requires 20 CPU cores, 5GB of memory per core, and a 10-hour time limit.
The script uses Python to modify confound files.
The script utilizes disk space for input files, output files, and temporary working directory.
The script requires network connectivity for accessing Singularity container images and potentially external resources.
